Nemuro Station (根室駅) is the final stop on the JR Nemuro Main Line (also called the Hanasaki Line) from
.  Service is sparse: two daily express trains (just over two hours from Kushiro) and six locals (just over three hours).  Add on another four hours from

.

The second-to-last stop, Higashi-Nemuro Station (東根室駅), may be of interest to train buffs as the easternmost station in all of Japan.

value: alt=根室観光インフォメーションセンター
content=The staff here can help you find directions, things to do, lodging, and food.  They have free maps, too.  There is also a small gift shop.
content=The eastern-most point in Hokkaido.  There is a small old lighthouse at the eastern-most point, and though the lighthouse is locked, it can make for a nice photograph.
content=Unique radial rock formation with a 6m diameter.
directions=Near the large tower at Cape Nosappu.
content=This museum has a history of Cape Nosappu, Nemuro, and the nearby islands.  There are maps, photos, and telescopes.  Next to the building is a large archway and permanently flaming torch.

Even within Japan Nemuro is renowned for its fish and is a contender for one of the best dining destinations in Hokkaido. Sanma and Hanasaki crab are local delicacies which also merit their own festivals. There is a surprisingly wide array of cuisines and eateries in this otherwise quiet and far-flung town.

value: directions=On the north side of Highway 44 about 10km west of central Nemuro.

content=This restaurant also has cabins for rent.  It is located on the edge of a large lake, which makes for good bird watching.  There are even binoculars at the tables for customers to use while waiting for food to arrive.
directions=On the corner of Highway 44 and Ekimae Dori, 2 blocks N of Nemuro Station.

directions=On the main road into town, about a 10 minute walk from Nemuro Station.

content=Nemuro's finest kaiten-sushi restaurant serving extremely fresh locally caught fish. Very popular with locals, especially on Friday and Saturday evenings, waits possible, but worth it. There are also branches in
, but this is the original and the best!
directions=A 2 minute walk from Nemuro Station.
hours=11:00 to 23:00 weekdays, 12:00 to 23:00, Sundays and holidays

content=A cosy log cabin restaurant and coffee house with eclectic décor. The wood burning stove is particularly welcome in winter. Serves mostly western food adapted for Japanese tastes. The Yaki Curry is a particular recommendation, as are the seasonal deserts. Also sells and grinds an original blend of coffee beans.
directions=Between Nemuro Station and Highway 44 on the east side of the road.
content=This is a coffee shop that also serves alcohol.  It plays jazz music all the time, and has a relaxing ambiance.

As with much of Hokkaido, tent campers should feel free to set up tent after dark at a public rest area or parking area.  If the tent is taken down before 9AM, nobody will mind.

value: directions=On the north side of Highway 44 about 10km west of central Nemuro.
price=Depending on cabin size, ¥3800 per person, ¥800 for breakfast
content=This place has many cabins for rental.  There are cabins for 1-2, 3-4, 4-5, or 6-8 people.  There is also an attached restaurant.
